item.title: You Can’t Pause The Black Ops 7 Campaign, Ever
item.content:encoded:
It might be a sign of the times, or just a strange decision on Activision and Treyarch’s part, but the campaign aspect of Black Ops 7 cannot be paused, meaning you have to keep playing and progressing until the mission is over, or you reach a checkpoint.

Yes, this marks the first time ever that you can’t pause a Call of Duty campaign. Black Ops 7‘s campaign utilizes an always-online aspect, meaning the game is live at all times. This has several huge implications for your game and means progress and progression can be interrupted at all times.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Campaign Can’t Be Paused

Black Ops 7’s campaign has attracted a lot of discourse because of the nature of its content. One thing that can’t be overlooked is the campaign being always online. In previous games, when you pause the game, the action stops. End of story.

That’s not the case here, and the action carries on—think of it like a FromSoftware game where you bring up a menu, but the world is still active. You can die, lose your progress, and go back to the start of the checkpoint. This isn’t ideal when you’re playing on Veteran difficulty, for example.

ModernWarzone also shared a clip of someone’s campaign journey, and while the user is trying to watch a cutscene, Black Ops 7 suddenly decides in that moment to drop the Daily Update.

This instantly derails any campaign momentum and throws you out to the main menu.

Treyarch might enable some kind of offline workaround later on, but this is unlikely due to the game’s online integration and the addition of Worlds Collide.

Is this a bad move from Treyarch? Does this put you off playing the campaign altogether? Head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and let us know what you think of this decision.

item.title: Escape from Tarkov 1.0 Trailer Shows New Map, Interactive Traders, and Black Division
item.content:encoded:
Battlestate Games has pushed out a new Escape from Tarkov 1.0 trailer, celebrating the imminent launch of the game after ten years in development. It comes just one day before the update (or release) is set to drop, bringing an end to ten years of testing. The highly anticipated release will come hand-in-hand with the exciting feature to finally escape from Tarkov.

Plenty is showcased in the trailer, which, in true Battlestate Games fashion, has the characters dying over, and over, and over again. It’s true to the game, at least.

Tarkov 1.0 Trailer is Here

All week, Battlestate Games has been writhing in nostalgia, sharing old trailers and tidbits from Escape from Tarkov’s ten-year development lifecycle. In an epic milestone, the team is finally pushing the game into a 1.0 state, and it’ll be released worldwide tomorrow.

Here’s the 1.0 trailer for your enjoyment:

It’s an exciting time for fans of the extraction genre. From the launch of Escape from Tarkov to the skyrocketing success of ARC Raiders, and from the superstar performance of the satirical Escape from Duckov to the recent leaks concerning the Far Cry extraction shooter, there’s plenty to be enthused about.

Escape from Tarkov will be released tomorrow on Steam, which marks the first time that the extraction shooter has appeared on a platform outside of Battlestate Games’ proprietary launcher. It’ll hopefully attract an entirely new audience to the game.

Also, there’s a Twitch Drops campaign set to run from this weekend into early December that’ll reward users for watching their favorite streamers play the new update.

Are you excited about the launch of Escape from Tarkov? Let me know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: All Europa Universalis 5 Console Commands & Cheats—How To Enable Console Commands, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Europa Universalis 5 carries on Paradox Interactive’s good work in the strategy genre. In contrast, many fans flock to other well-known franchises for their world-conquering needs. Europa Universalis 5 offers all of this and more, and its console commands and cheats are a lot of fun if you feel like messing about with the world.

It’s not easy for Europa Universalis 5 to compete with the Anno 117: Pax Romana and Civilization 7s of the world. Yet, here we are with another mainline addition to the long-running franchise. It has all the usual mechanics to consider: Ruling through dynasties, shaping your nation, dictating its fate for hundreds of years.

If you want a little helping hand, the Europa Universalis 5 console commands on PC might be a good little companion.

Every Europa Universalis 5 Console Command & Cheat

A little Black Death here and another world-altering event there, and suddenly your best-laid plans are up in smoke faster than a marshmallow held too long over a campfire. Europa Universalis 5 cheats offer ways to counter almost anything, or let you run amok with the best settings on from the start.

Here’s every Europa Universalis 5 Console Command & Cheat, including the command and what it does:

  • age, change_age [<age_tag>]: Changes the age.
  • ArmyTradition: adds ArmyTradition.
  • build_everything [<location> <id> / <country> <tag> / <region> <id> /all]: Build everything possible in a location, country, or region.
  • cash: adds cash.
  • change_government [<Government Type>]: Change the government of your country.
  • create_character [<male/female>] [lowborn/random/new]: Lets you create a Character.
  • debug_mode: Toggles debug mode.
  • disaster, activate_disaster [<disaster>]: Let’s you activate disaster.
  • discover [<location key> / all]: Discover location.
  • disease, spawn_disease [<disease>]: Spawns a disease.
  • Doom: adds Doom.
  • event [eventid] [target]: Trigger an event of your choice.
  • form_union [<junior partner>]: Form a union with another country.
  • freeze [<location>]: Freezes an ocean.
  • GovernmentPower: adds GovernmentPower.
  • Harmony: adds Harmony.
  • Honor: adds Honor.
  • Inflation: adds Inflation.
  • Karma: adds Karma.
  • kill_character [<id>]: Kills a character of your choosing.
  • kill_all_units [<CountryTag>]: Kill all units in target country.
  • Manpower: adds Manpower.
  • NavyTradition: adds NavyTradition.
  • population [<location>]: Increases or decreases a location’s population.
  • Prestige: adds Prestige.
  • Purity: adds Purity.
  • religion [<religion>]: Changes a country’s religion.
  • ReligiousInfluence: adds ReligiousInfluence.
  • resupply_all_units [<CountryTag>]: Max food for all units in target country.
  • Righteousness: adds Righteousness.
  • RitePower: adds RitePower.
  • Sailors: adds Sailors.
  • screenshot: Take a screenshot.
  • SelfControl: adds SelfControl.
  • settings: Spawns a settings GUI.
  • set_flag [<flag_definition>]: Overrides a country’s flag.
  • Stability: adds Stability.
  • tick_day [number of days]: Moves the game forward a set number of days.
  • TickTask.Graph: Open a graph of tasks.
  • time: Shows what the time is.
  • WarExhaustion: adds WarExhaustion.
  • weather [<location> <front/cyclone/tornado>]: Changes weather.
  • Yanantin: adds Yanantin.
  • YesMan: toggles the cheat mode.

How To Use Europa Universalis 5 Console Commands

Activating Europa Universalis 5 Console Commands is as simple as enabling and opening the Debug Mode option, typing each cheat into the box, and triggering it.

Here’s a quick instructional guide on how to do this (using Steam as our example):

  1. Open up Steam.
  2. Find Europa Universalis 5 in your game library.
  3. Right-click the title.
  4. Select Properties.
  5. Choose Launch Options.
  6. Copy and paste -debug_mode into it.
  7. Boot up Europa Universalis 5.
  8. Press the ` key once the game has loaded.
  9. You can now enter prompts using our list above!

You can now adjust food levels, change religions, and all manner of world-tinkering actions. Our favorites include the ability to trigger an event, because as Heath Ledger’s Joker said: “I’m an agent of chaos.”

Have fun building and destroying your own history of humanity.

If you feel we’ve missed any console commands, or if any aren’t working for you, let us know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Cast Revealed—All Voice Actors Explained
item.content:encoded:
Black Ops 7 is now available and there are a host of familiar actors starring in the game, and we’re here to help if you can’t put your finger on where exactly you recognize a Call of Duty voice actor from.

Released November 14, Black Ops 7 is the latest instalment in the long-running Call of Duty franchise and has plenty to sink your teeth into, including a new endgame mode in campaign, multiplayer, Zombies, and Warzone to come in future.

Across all modes, recognizable voices will be heard, and we can tell you exactly who the Black Ops 7 voice actors are and where you may know them from.

All Major Actors in Black Ops 7

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has a variety of actors starring, with some providing their likeness and voices to roles, while others are voice actors.

Big names include Michael Rooker, Milo Ventimiglia, Nolan North, and Steve Blum, who have all starred in a host of other games, films, and TV series’ respectively.

A full list of the actors and voice actors appearing in Black Ops 7, per IMDB, is shown in the table below.

Black Ops 7 Voice Actors’ Past Roles

If there are a few names in the list above you recognize but can’t quite place your finger on where you know them from, here’s a breakdown of some of the actors and their previous roles.

Milo Ventimiglia

Milo Ventimiglia shot to fame with the role of Peter Petrelli in the mid-2000’s TV series Heroes, and starred as Jack Pearson in over 100 episodes of This Is Us from 2016-2022.

Black Ops 7 is only his second video game appearance, from what we can find, with his debut coming in 2011’s X-Men: Destiny. He’s also voiced Wolverine in a TV Mini Series, and lended his voice to Spider-Man Noir in the Ultimate Spider-Man Anime.

Michael Rooker

Michael Rooker first appeared in the Call of Duty franchise over a decade ago in Black Ops 2, and has also starred in The Walking Dead as Merle Dixon, and as Yondu in the Marvel Cinematic Universe—a role he has reprised for some anime series.

In recent years, Rooker has had fleeting appearances in The Rookie, Creature Commandos, and Peacemaker, as well as providing a voice for a Superman Robot in this year’s blockbuster film.

Steve Blum

Steve Blum is a familiar name in video games, having voiced both Wolverine and Venom in Marvel Rivals, as well as appearing in titles like Date Everything! and Mortal Kombat 1.

Other standout roles include voicing Zeb Orrelios in Star Wars: Rebels, Spike Spiegel in Cowboy Bebop: The Movie, and Starscream in Transformers Prime.

Nolan North

Nolan North is another familiar voice across TV and video games, with 30 credited appearances in Rick and Morty and eight appearances in Family Guy, but it’s his video game roles where he stands out.

His roles include Rocket Raccoon in Marvel Rivals, Superman & Penguin in Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, Modi in God of War Ragnarok, Deadpool in Marvel’s Midnight Suns, and Iron Man in Marvel’s Avengers.

item.title: What is Cursed Mode in Black Ops 7 Zombies? New Mode, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Black Ops 7 has landed, with Zombies once again returning to the Call of Duty franchise, and there is another way to play this time around with the addition of Cursed Mode—and we’ve got an explanation of exactly what it is.

Zombies in Black Ops 7 has plenty to uncover, with an in-depth narrative to follow that continues on from the events of Black Ops 6 and a wealth of exclusive Camos to unlock.

Cursed Mode in Black Ops 7 Zombies provides the biggest challenge of all, however, and we’ve got a breakdown of what you can expect from the mode.

What is Cursed Mode in Black Ops 7 Zombies?

Cursed Mode in Black Ops 7 Zombies is a hardcore version of the mode, providing a challenge for those familiar with the Zombies mechanics and turning back a more original style.

Players are limited from the off, starting with just a Pistol, and can unlock Easter Eggs and Quests to unlock ‘Relics’—which have a similar style to Skulls in the Halo franchise. Once unlocked, they can be applied to the start of any Cursed run and provide extra challenge.

Each Relic provides debuffs to increase the challenge, and there are three difficulty tiers of Cursed mode that increase with the amount of Relics activated. However, there are also small buffs available at each difficult level, such as Golden Armor purchasable off the wall in Tier 1.

The core differences for cursed mode are detailed below:

  • Players start the match with Pistol only.
  • Loadout weapons are unavailable.
  • Minimap is disabled.
  • Black Ops 3-style point system.
  • Modified ammo costs.
  • Maximum four active Perks.
  • No Ammo Caches.

How to Unlock Cursed Mode in Black Ops 7 Zombies

Cursed Mode only becomes available in Black Ops 7 when the Ashes of the Damned main quest has been completed for the first time.

This can be done by finding the steps and working your way through the Ashes of the Damned main quest yourself, or by waiting for the Directed Mode to release—which is expected to arrive in Season 1.

Once unlocked, Cursed Mode is permanently available for players to select as one of the four Zombies options alongside Standard Mode, Directed Mode, and Survival.

Should Zombies return to the old style with only a pistol as a starting weapon? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.
